comments.author: Dave
comments.body: I'd just finished up a nasty opraectomy when one of the orderlies told me I had a call. I took it on the phone in the scrub room. A voice, reed thin and immediately annoying, told me, "I just saw one of your patients riding a bicycle in Four Mile Canyon." It was Scube Bellows, my eyes and ears on the outside world. I'd hired him two years ago to do follow-up on my patients, and though he made my skin crawl like a snake on glass, he was good at what he did. "Which patient?" "The tall one, the big dumbass you did the rib-job on last week. He was half way up the canyon with one of his buddies, a knobby-kneed little tweaker from the trade school. Had a smile on his mug like the grill on a '57 Buick, and he was riding one of those big pink circus bikes. It was him alright." "So, did you bring him in?" "Sure did. He's out in the van right now. What you want I should do with him?" "Bring the moron up to the O.R.. I think this time I'll..." To be continued....
